g_applicant_not_disambiguated.description: order of the applicants on the patent application, beginning with zero; sequence for this table begins at {1}.

The type of interest the applicant has in the intellectual property rights of a patent or application. May be equal to inventor, legal-representative, party-of-interest, obligated-assignee, assignee, or null.
first name, if applicant is an individual
last name, if applicant is an individual
organization name if applicant is an organization
unique location id generated by the disambiguation algorithm

g_application.description: patent application series code: 01-17 = utility application; 29 = design application; 35 = international design applications; 60-62 = provisional application; 90 = ex parte reexamination request; 95 = inter partes reexamination request; 96 = supplemental examination
date of application filing, ISO format: YYYY-MM-DD
flag for inventor who was unable to be contacted at filing of patent

g_assignee_disambiguated.description: order in which assignee appears in patent file; sequence for this table begins at {0}.
unique assignee ID generated by the disambiguation algorithm
first name, if assignee is an individual
last name, if assignee is an individual
organization name if assignee is an organization

classification of assignee (1 - Unassigned, 2 - US Company or Corporation, 3 - Foreign Company or Corporation, 4 - US Individual, 5 - Foreign Individual, 6 - US Federal Government, 7 - Foreign Government, 8 - US County Government, 9 - US State Government. Note: A "1" appearing before any of these codes signifies part interest
unique location id generated by the disambiguation algorithm

g_assignee_not_disambiguated.description: order in which the assignees are listed in the raw XML for current patent; sequence for this table begins at {0}.
unique assignee ID generated by the disambiguation algorithm
first name, if assignee is an individual
last name, if assignee is an individual
organization name if assignee is an organization

assignee type (1- Unassigned, 2 - US Company or Corporation, 3 - Foreign Company or Corporation, 4 - US Individual, 5 - Foreign Individual, 6 - US Federal Government, 7 - Foreign Government, 8 - US County Government, 9 - US State Government. Note: A "1" appearing before any of these codes signifies part interest)
assignee's location. If the assignee's sequence number is 0, then his/her location is the "location" of the related patent

g_attorney_disambiguated.description: order in which attorney is listed on the patent file; sequence for this table begins at {0}.
unique lawyer ID generated by the disambiguation algorithm
first name of attorney or agent
last name of attorney or agent

g_attorney_not_disambiguated.description: order in which the attorneys are listed in the raw XML for current patent; sequence for this table begins at {0}.
unique attroney id generated by the disambiguation algorithm
first name of attorney or agent
last name of attorney or agent
organization name of attorney or agent

g_brf_sum_text.description: text of the summary itself, excluding headings

g_claim.description: order in which claims appear in patent file; sequence for this table begins at {0}.
sequence number of claim this is dependent on. NULL if independent
Contains claim number of claim formatted as 0-prefixed 5 digit number. This column will have a range of claims if those claims are cancelled
whether the claim is one of the exemplary claims of the patent; 1 if exemplary claim, 0 otherwise

g_cpc_current.description: order in which cpc class appears in patent file; sequence for this table begins at {0}.

cpc section (A = Human Necessitates, B = Performing Operations; Transporting, C = Chemistry; Metallurgy, D = Textiles; Paper, E = Fixed Constructions, F = Mechanical Engineering; Lighting; Heating; Weapons; Blasting Engines or Pumps, G = Physics, H = Electricity, Y = General Tagging of New Technological Developments)

g_detail_desc_text.description: text of the description itself, excluding headings

g_draw_desc_text.description: order in which drawing descriptions appear in patent file, often the same as the figure id; sequence for this table begins at {1}.
text of the description itself, excluding headings

g_examiner_not_disambiguated.description: whether this individual was the primary or assistant examiner
art unit, tech center, industry sector, or other grouping of US patent examiners

g_figures.description: number of figures included with patent
number of drawing sheets included with patent

g_foreign_citation.description: order in which this citation is cited by patent; sequence for this table begins at {0}.
identifying number of patent/application to which select patent cites
who cited the patent (examiner, applicant, other etc)

g_foreign_priority.description: order in which priority claims appear in patent file; sequence for this table begins at {0}.
type of priority claim (international, national, regional)
date at which patent was previously filed
country in which patent was originally filed (transformed name)

g_gov_interest_org.description: name of Federal department, agency, bureau, etc.

position of the focal agency in a hierarchical set of relationships with the parent agency (e.g., DHHS) at level_one and child agencies at lower levels (e.g., NIH at level_two and NIDA at level_three). government_organization.name is equal to one and only one of the values in level_one, level_two, and level_three

position of the focal agency in a hierarchical set of relationships with the parent agency (e.g., DHHS) at level_one and child agencies at lower levels (e.g., NIH at level_two and NIDA at level_three). government_organization.name is equal to one and only one of the values in level_one, level_two, and level_three

position of the focal agency in a hierarchical set of relationships with the parent agency (e.g., DHHS) at level_one and child agencies at lower levels (e.g., NIH at level_two and NIDA at level_three). government_organization.name is equal to one and only one of the values in level_one, level_two, and level_three

g_inventor_disambiguated.description: order in which inventor appears in file; sequence for this table begins at {0}.
unique inventor id generated by the disambiguation algorithm
attributed inventor gender (F = female, M = male, U = no gender attributed)
unique location id generated by the disambiguation algorithm

g_inventor_not_disambiguated.description: order in which the inventors are listed in the raw XML for current patent; sequence for this table begins at {0}.
unique inventor id generated by the disambiguation algorithm
flag to indicate if the inventor has deceased
inventor's location. If the inventor's sequence number is 0, then his/her location is the "location" of the related patent

g_ipc_at_issue.description: order in which ipc class appears in patent file; sequence for this table begins at {0}.

ipc section (A = Human Necessitates, B = Performing Operations; Transporting, C = Chemistry; Metallurgy, D = Textiles; Paper, E = Fixed Constructions, F = Mechanical Engineering; Lighting; Heating; Weapons; Blasting, G = Physics, H = Electricity)
ipc classification value ( I = invention information; N = non-invention information)
ipc classification status ( B = Basic or Original)
ipc classification data source ( H = Human - Generated; M = Machine - Generated; G = Generated via Software)
issue date of the patent grant

g_location_disambiguated.description: unique location id generated by the disambiguation algorithm
disambiguated city associated with a location_id
disambiguated state associated with a location_id
disambiguated country associated with a location_id
state FIPS code associated with a location_id
county FIPS code associated with a location_id

g_location_not_disambiguated.description: unique location id generated by the disambiguation algorithm
raw city associated with a location_id
raw state associated with a location_id
raw country associated with a location_id

g_other_reference.description: order in which this reference appears in the raw XML for the current patent; sequence for this table starts at 0.

g_patent.description: whether a patent has been withdrawn or not (withdrawn = 1, not withdrawn = 0)
name of the raw data file where patent information is parsed from

g_pct_data.description: PCT Section 371(c)(1)(2)(4)date, date when pct application was filed
kind of application (numerical for filed, alphabetical for published)
whether the document has been published or just filed

g_persistent_assignee.description: the disambiguated assignee ids associated with the raw assignee on a given pgpub document with the given sequence during the data updates matching the date stamps in the field names. Data on this table goes back to the 20181127 update.
order in which assignee appears in patent file; sequence for this table begins at {0}.

g_persistent_inventor.description: the disambiguated inventor ids associated with the raw inventor on a given pgpub document with the given sequence during the data updates matching the date stamps in the field names. Data on this table goes back to the 20170808 update.
order in which inventor appears in patent file; sequence for this table begins at {0}.

g_rel_app_text.description: text of the description of the related application in question

g_uspc_at_issue.description: order in which uspc class appears in patent file; sequence for this table begins at {0}.

g_us_application_citation.description: order in which this reference is cited by select patent; sequence for this table begins at {0}.
publication number of application to which select patent cites
first day of the month the cited patent (citation_id) was published
who cited the application (examiner, applicant, other etc)

g_us_patent_citation.description: order in which this reference is cited by select patent; sequence for this table begins at {0}.
identifying number of patent to which select patent cites
first day of the month the cited patent (citation_id) was granted
who cited the patent (examiner, applicant, other etc)

g_us_rel_doc.description: country where related document was published
publication date of the related document
order in which the related document appears in patent file; sequence for this table begins at {0}.

g_us_term_of_grant.description: disclaimer if the patent is subject to a terminal disclaimer
the length of time during which a patent is in force (i.e. the inventor(s) or assignee(s) have exclusive rights to the invention) in years
an extension to the grant term period in days

g_wipo_technology.description: order in which WIPO technology field appears on patent; sequence for this table begins at {0}.
WIPO technology field id as derived from crosswalk http://www.wipo.int/export/sites/www/ipstats/en/statistics/patents/xls/ipc_technology.xls
